comments:
We have two WSDL files:
-one with wsdl:types, wsdl:message, wsdl:portType
-second with wsdl:service and wsdl:binding. This file also has <import location=....namespace=..../> to the first file.
If we try to call refactor from popup menu to rename portType in second file, we get ClassCastException in ErrorLog. Investigation shows that this element is ElementNSImpl(), and couldn't be casted to IDOMElement.

 java.lang.ClassCastException
	at org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.ui.internal.refactor.actions.RenameComponentAction.doCanEnableWSDLSelection(RenameComponentAction.java:112)
	at org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.ui.internal.refactor.actions.RenameComponentAction.canEnable(RenameComponentAction.java:126)
	at org.eclipse.wst.xsd.ui.internal.refactor.actions.SelectionDispatchAction.selectionChanged(SelectionDispatchAction.java:87)

The refactor option should be disabled in this scenario.  Users should not be able to refactor on read-only components.  Users should open the imported file (by double clicking on the read-only porttype or right clicking on the read-only porttype and selecting the open editor option), then select the refactoring option.
Please take a look at this Joshua.  Basically, we need to make the popup menu for imported components disabled for the refactoring option.  Thanks.
Tried this scenario with the latest WTP 3.0 build and it's no longer a problem.
